history.content:
Might be too hard. 170 and 126 are very heavy theoretical courses, and if CS 70 wasn't a cakewalk for you, both of these courses in together will be really difficult. ?None of those courses have huge projects (CS 170 has a final project at the end, but it's not too time consuming).

CS 188 is also pretty heavy theory, but I don't think it would be as troublesome as 170 or 126. Projects are pretty easy, and all assignments are edX, so workload-wise it's not too bad. However, studying for exams might be a bit hard. 

CS 61C is another beast altogether. There's a couple of projects (CPU and Assembler) that are very difficult. However, the other ones are pretty manageable. Content is a hit or miss: if you're good at CS 70-like courses, I think it'll be the hardest course on your list. If you don't find theory easy, then I'd put it between CS 188 and CS 170/EE 126 in terms of difficulty. 

If you're pretty strong with theory courses, I'd reserve CS 61C for another semester when your course load is lighter. If not, definitely put off EE 126 or CS 170 for some other semester.

children.subject: we're gonna win bigly, it's gonna fantastik, huuge, it's called the world of winning and success.

This is a message I gave to another student a few days back on piazza:

Whatever you decide to do, make sure to assess your personal abilities very well, and I don't get too carried away with what others have to say. Make sure that only you are your number one source of decision making, not other students on Piazza. I made the mistake of only taking 3 classes this semester (all of which were techs), because several students on Piazza told me that 4 techs would be too heavy. Well..it turned out to be a boring and somewhat uninspiring semester. So next semester I'm going for 5 or 6 classes. People are now urging me to not do this, but at this point I have assessed my capabilities well enough to trust myself.

history.content:
I am planning to take these courses next semester.

Is it doable? Many people say no. If not, what are the main challenges I will face (overlapping projects, etc).
history.subject: Is EE 126, CS 188, CS 170, CS 61C too much?
